derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (as a verb): from Latin excerpt- 'plucked out', from the verb excerpere, from ex- 'out of' + carpere 'to pluck'

entry.def: An excerpt is a short piece of writing or music which is taken from a larger piece.

example.tran: 柴可夫斯基的《胡桃夹子》选段

entry.def: If a long piece of writing or music is excerpted, short pieces from it are printed or played on their own.

example.ex: The readings you heard earlier were excerpted from a new oral history of Pearl Harbor.
example.tran: 你之前听到的朗读片段节选自一部新的珍珠港口述史。

means.word_mean: 1. a passage selected from a larger work;

sentences.sentence: "he presented excerpts from William James' philosophical writings"

means.word_mean: 1. take out of a literary work in order to cite or copy
